definition: Zhuangzi 莊子|庄子 dreams of a butterfly (or is it the butterfly dreaming of Zhuangzi?)
farmstead/village/manor/place of business/banker (in a gambling game)/grave or solemn/holdings of a landlord (in imperial China)
to make a circuit/to circle/circle/circumference/lap/cycle/complete/all/all over/thorough/to help financially
dream/CL:場|场[chang2],個|个[ge4]/(bound form) to dream
see 黃粱夢|黄粱梦[huang2 liang2 meng4]
same as Zhuangzi 莊子|庄子 (369-286 BC), Daoist author
separated by a generation/a lifetime ago
mystery within a mystery/the mysteries of the Dao according to Laozi 老子[Lao3 zi3]
lit. flowers in a mirror and the moon reflected in the lake (idiom)/fig. an unrealistic rosy view/viewing things through rose-tinted spectacles/also written 水月鏡花|水月镜花
dream of golden millet/fig. illusions of wealth and glory/pipe dream
to use sth as a metaphor
Lie Zi, Daoist author, said to be early Warring States period 戰國|战国/Daoist text in eight chapters, said to be by Lie Zi, probably compiled during WeiJin times 魏晉|魏晋 (3rd century AD)
